title: What is the *args pararmeter meant to be for an upgradable contract deployment?
body:
Please do not open an issue to request support. This repository's issues are reserved for feature requests and bug reports.

If you have a question about how to use Brownie:

* First, please check the [Brownie documentation](https://eth-brownie.readthedocs.io/).
* If you still have a question, consider asking on [Ethereum StackExchange](https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/). This way others can also benefit from the answers you receive.
* You can also join our [Gitter](https://gitter.im/eth-brownie/community) to speak to the team and other community members.

I am trying to deploy an upgradable contract with brownie.

Here is how I call it :

```
    reward_adel = deploy_proxy(deployer, proxy_admin, Rewards)
```

However, I get this error:

```
  File "brownie/_cli/run.py", line 49, in main
    return_value, frame = run(
  File "brownie/project/scripts.py", line 103, in run
    return_value = f_locals[method_name](*args, **kwargs)
  File "./scripts/deploy_reward.py", line 50, in main
    reward_adel = deploy_proxy(deployer, proxy_admin, Rewards)
  File "./utils/deploy_helpers.py", line 24, in deploy_proxy
    initializer_data = contract_impl.initialize.encode_input(*args)
  File "brownie/network/contract.py", line 1592, in encode_input
    data = format_input(self.abi, args)
  File "brownie/convert/normalize.py", line 20, in format_input
    raise type(e)(f"{abi['name']} {e}") from None
ValueError: initialize Sequence has incorrect length, expected 1 but got 0
```

Unfortunately , I seem to be missing the intilization arguments. However , the contract doesnt have a constructor. 
What am i doing wrong?

Once your upgradable contract is deployed, you'll need to call `initialize` on it with the required parameters. 

Example:

```
args = [
arg1,
arg2,
arg3
]

YourContract.deploy({"from": dev})

YourContract.initialize(*args, {"from": dev})
```
